DOC.brief_title: Interpersonal Treatment Program Prevent Depression Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder Low-Income Pregnant Women With Partner Abuse
DOC.detailed_description: Each year , approximately 324,000 pregnant woman experience partner abuse ( PA ) . With emotional high low accompany new motherhood , pregnancy often challenge process many woman . Experiencing PA , already go vulnerable time pregnancy , may harmful effect well-being woman infant . Women affect PA increase risk certain physical psychological problem , include depression post-traumatic stress disorder ( PTSD ) . Furthermore , emotional distress PA may impair woman 's ability seek necessary support ensure safety child . There research effort develop effective treatment reduce psychological impact PA pregnant woman even few effort target low-income woman , make large portion affect woman . The Reach Out Safe Environment ( ROSE ) program interpersonally orient treatment develop address factor may contribute postpartum mental health difficulty associate PA . This study evaluate effectiveness ROSE program prevent depression PTSD low-income pregnant woman experience recent PA . Participation single-blind study last approximately 29 week . All potential participant answer initial questionnaire concern history physical , sexual , emotional abuse past year . Selected participant undergo interview symptom depression , reaction trauma , emotional difficulty , alcohol drug use . Participants invite continue study randomly assign ROSE program enhance care usual ( ECU ) . Participants assign ROSE program attend four weekly 90-minute group session prior delivery one individual 50-minute booster session within 4 week delivery . During session , participant learn way manage stress negative feeling access helpful resource . Participants also complete two questionnaire emotional difficulty per week duration program . Participants assign ECU receive usual medical care provide pregnant woman receive educational material depression . All participant complete questionnaire interview emotional difficulty , relationship others , use service difficulty prior treatment assignment , 4 week treatment assignment , 4 week delivery , 3 month delivery . Participants ROSE program additionally complete questionnaire perception program fourth treatment session booster session .
